content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code for cleaning a column name:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return lowercase(replace(strip(col), r"[ _-]+", "_"))
end
```

This function works by first converting all characters to lower case using `lowercase` and then replacing any sequence of spaces, hyphens or underscores with a single underscore. The regular expression `r"[ _-]+"` matches one or more spaces, hyphens or underscores. 

You can use this function like so:
```julia
col = " My Column "
clean_column(col) # returns "my_column"
```
